data.title: Restaurant recommendations
data.solution:
"""
Coding is fun... Until it errors - The_ZimaBlue

"""
def restaurant_recommendations(restaurants, ratings, costs, cond):
    """(list, list, list) -> str

    Returns best restaurant
    """
    least_cost = 10
    max_rating = 0
    my_recommendation = ''


    if cond == 'cost':
        for index in range(len(restaurants)):
            length = len(costs[index])
            if length < least_cost:
                least_cost = length
                my_recommendation = restaurants[index]
    else:
        for index in range(len(restaurants)):
            rating = int(ratings[index])
            if rating > max_rating:
                max_rating = rating
                my_recommendation = restaurants[index]

    if len(my_recommendation) == 0:
        return 'Eat at home'
    return my_recommendation

restaurants = []
ratings = []
costs = []
my_condition = input()
num = int(input())
for i in range(num):
    restaurant, rating, cost = input().split()
    restaurants.append(restaurant)
    ratings.append(int(rating[:rating.find('%')]))
    costs.append(cost)
print(restaurant_recommendations(restaurants, ratings, costs, my_condition))
data.statement:
<<Storyline:>>
You are creating an app to choose the best restaurant.

<<The Problem:>>
You must find either the cheapest or highest rated restaurant with a given condition.

<<Notes:>>
[[condition]] will either be 'cost' or 'rating'
[[num]] is the number of restaurant options
[[cost]] will be: '$' or '$$' or '$$$' or '$$$$' or '$$$$$'
[[rating]] will be a percentage ex. 87%

If there are no restaurants print 'Eat at home'
If there is a tie you must output the first inputted restaurant with the tied value

testCases.title: Cost
testCases.testIn:
cost
5
Taco_Bell 80% $$
Mexican_Grill 50% $$$
Torchy's_Tacos 90% $$$$
Mr.Mayer 33% $
Sushi_For_2 99% $$$$

testCases.testIn:
cost
10
Burger_King 90% $$
Taco_Hut 70% $
B♥RGER 92% $
Mr.Mayer's 98% $
Pizza_King 90% $$
Sushi_Hut 70% $
BURGERforGODS 10% $$$$
Burger_Hut 95% $$$
NON 92% $
Oyalo's_Pizza 89% $

data.stubGenerator:
read condition:string(1000)
read num:int
loop num read restaurant:word(100) rating:word(100) cost:word(100)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[condition]] for the sort method
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[num]] for the number of restaurants
<<Next [[num]] lines:>> Restaurants as [[name]] [[rating]] [[cost]]
<<Where:>>
 [[name]] is a string
 [[rating]] is a percentage, e.g. 99%
 [[cost]] is a string of '$' characters, e.g. $$$

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Storyline:
You are creating an app to choose the best restaurant.

The Problem:
You must find either the cheapest or highest rated restaurant with a given condition.

Notes:
condition will either be 'cost' or 'rating'
num is the number of restaurant options
cost will be: '$' or '$$' or '$$$' or '$$$$' or '$$$$$'
rating will be a percentage ex. 87%

If there are no restaurants print 'Eat at home'
If there is a tie you must output the first inputted restaurant with the tied value
Input
Line 1: A string condition for the sort method
Line 2: An integer num for the number of restaurants
Next num lines: Restaurants as name rating cost
Where:
name is a string
rating is a percentage, e.g. 99%
cost is a string of '$' characters, e.g. $$$
Output
my_recommendation: String
Constraints
0 < Length of condition, restaurant, rating, cost < 100
0 < num < 100
Example
Input
cost
5
Taco_Bell 80% $$
Mexican_Grill 50% $$$
Torchy's_Tacos 90% $$$$
Mr.Mayer 33% $
Sushi_For_2 99% $$$$
Output
Mr.Mayer
